title: How does the Brexit 50p compare to the rarest and most valuable British coins in circulation?
text:
The Treasury is to mint 10 million Brexit 50p coins, a third of which will be ready to spend by the end of next month.

The new coins will be marked with the words "Friendship with all nations". However they will be stamped with the expected date of Brexit: Oct 31, rather than the previous date of March 31.

The Royal Mint regularly issues special coins to mark national moments, such as the London 2012 Olympics.

The Brexit 50p's mintage makes it significantly more common than previous commemorative coins. So which are the most valuable?
